New York University Archives
Madeleine Dale Collection on Robert Francis Dale and Martha Forland Bernstein Dale
Dale, Madeleine
Dale, Madeleine
Dale, Martha Forland Bernstein
MC.361
1.25 linear feet in 1 flat box and 1 folder in shared housing
1930-1965 Martha Forland Bernstein Dale was a student at the New York University School of Education during the late 1930s and early 1940s. She met her husband, Robert Francis Dale, while a student, and the couple married in 1942. Bernstein Dale was an active member of the Education Club, student council, and Sigma Pi Chi Sorority, Eta Chapter. She also served as editor-in-chief of the Education Violet yearbook and the secretary of the French Students' Correspondence Exchange. In the early 1960s, Bernstein Dale returned to NYU to earn a second Bachelor's degree in order to work as a substitute teacher. The Madeleine Dale Collection on Robert Francis Dale and Martha Forland Bernstein Dale consists of a scrapbook created by Bernstein Dale documenting her experiences as an New York University School of Education student in the 1930s and 1940s, as well as her relationship with Robert Francis Dale. The collection also includes commencement programs, NYU publications, a cosmetic compact, published and unpublished writings by Robert F. Dale, and ephemera, such as a dance card to the NYU prom.
Scope and Contents
The Madeleine Dale Collection on Robert Francis Dale and Martha Forland Bernstein Dale consists of a scrapbook created by Bernstein Dale documenting her experiences as an New York University School of Education student in the 1930s and 1940s, as well as her relationship with Robert Francis Dale. The collection also includes commencement programs, transcripts, NYU publications, a commemorative cosmetic compact, published and unpublished writings by Robert F. Dale, an issue of The Apprentice, and ephemera, such as a dance card to the 1942 NYU prom.
Biographical Note
Martha Forland Bernstein Dale was a student at the New York University School of Education during the late 1930s and early 1940s. She met her husband, Bob Francis Dale, while a student, and the couple married in 1942. Bernstein Dale was an active member of the Education Club, student council, and Sigma Pi Chi Sorority, Eta Chapter. She also served as editor-in-chief of the Education Violet yearbook and the secretary of the French Students' Correspondence Exchange. In the early 1960s, Bernstein Dale returned to NYU to earn a second Bachelor's degree in order to work as a substitute teacher.
Arrangement
This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open without restrictions.
Conditions Governing Use
This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
Immediate Source of Acquisition
Donated by Madeline Dale in October 2021 and July 2022; the accession numbers associated with these gift are 2021.058 and 2022.067.
Processing Information
At the time of accessioning, materials were rehoused by conservators in archival boxes and folders.
Preferred Citation
Identification of item, date; Madeleine Dale Collection on Robert Francis Dale and Martha Forland Bernstein Dale; MC 361; box number; folder number or item identifier; New York University Archives, New York University.
